Oh god this comment is a thing of beauty.
Finally, someone that sees him like Michael Bay too. I always thought that passives were to CT what explosions were to Bay.
You are a god with words. This is the analogy I've been looking for.

He makes cool and interesting designs and thematics. But his actual gameplay designs and choice are, for lack of a better term, chaotic. 

It makes me think of this (prepare for butchered analogy). Someone drawing a doodle of a character. They end up with a neat little design, but they keep adding stuff to it and can't bring themselves to stop. They keep adding more and more "stuff" until we end up with massive amounts of junk with the original doodle lost underneath it all. In short, over designing. 

And that's what CertainlyT has a habit of doing with his Champion kits. There's nothing wrong with making interesting or intricate kits but there comes a point when a champion's kit becomes too overloaded and that presents a huge problem. Because if one champion can have so many things it snuffs out champions that only have aspects of that in their own kits. 

Basically making a jack of all trades that has everything they could possibly need, ever. Over something more specialized. 
See Thresh as an example of the above (bar a heal).

Jax scales well into late game, but unlike most other late game monsters, he isn't very good at teamfights. He scales well into late in the sense that he is the best duelist bar none (maybe Nasus). Against teams that are not prepared to coordinate and CC him, he will be extremely problematic late.

> [{quoted}](name=YumaS2Astral,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hgY9g84s,comment-id=0009000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-17T02:21:15.827+0000)

Against teams that are not prepared to coordinate and CC him, he will be extremely problematic late.

Jax actually scales phenomenally into teamfights... his E is an AOE stun and invalidates ADC focus. His 4 second Q is nice mobility for the battlefield. His W burst is great for focusing down squishies. And his R makes his a tanky beast. The only way he's bad at teamfights is if you buy 5 damage items.

he's decent in teamfights but that's not his strength as he is a fighter who cannot be the one to initiate or jump in first. even with a few tank items you will still blow up relatively faster than a tank cuz you built trinity/bork(or gunblade). his ult gives him a lot of tankiness and you build a lot of health, but he still is relatively not the uber tank that can withstand a focus of all the team. however, if you act as cleanup duty once the fight starts...you can get easy pentas. most of my triple kills playing this game have been as jax. 

his late game is as stated...godly. you can literally 1 v 5 against certain comps and you're dueling power is just ridiculous. they need to send at least 3 people to take you down and if you are fed that might not be enough. If you get 3 dmg items and 2 tank with tanky boots you are pretty damn scary in fights where they cannot instantly delete you. I've had games where I have trinity, bork, gunblade, visage, randuins, boots. and lemme tell ya. he is a god. any extended trade jax will win outright by default because his sustain is unmatched and his power only gets stronger the longer a fight goes. his cooldowns are insanely short come late game. even the E is short considering what it does.

I've posted few ways on how to allow players help shaping LoL with "self balancing" mechanism, so they wouldn't create just next copies of CT aberrations. That could also be done for simply balancing champs. But nope.

Stonewall008 would be a good guy to talk to. Understands frustration that comes with playing against certain champions, very consistent in his balance theories, aware of niche/meta dependency, etc.  He's also outspoken on his criticisms of the game as a whole. Rito make it happen.
